body.p:
Paducah Kentucky
June 5th 1861
To His Excellency
B Maggofin Governor of Kentucky
Sir

I have the honor to enclose herewith the reply of Hon John A Gardner Confidential agent of His Excellency the Governor of Tennessee for the Western divission of the State, to my letter of the 28th Inst, a copy of which I enclosed by Capt Cobb

After my dispatches from Union City Tennessee by Capt Cobb, dated June 2nd I visited Columbus Ky in Company with Col Tilghman & Judge Bigger to have a Conference with prominent Citizens in regard to Col Austins plan for fortifying the place, I showed ^them^ your instructions to me, and also assured them, that the State of Tennessee had given me a pledge that neither guns, munitions of War, or Men from that State Would be allowed to go to Columbus for the purpose indicated, as it Would be a Violation of your Excellencies proclaimation as the line of policy which Ky had determined to assume -- awaiting your further instructions, I have the honor to be &C
